Detailed Description

The symbol class for hosting aliases.

An alias in the CubeScript programming language is a named string which can be executed or its stored value returned; an alias can serve as a variable or function for the script writer. Aliases are typically created and exist at runtime only; the alias assignment function registers newly created aliases to the domain passed from the expression object.

Member Function Documentation

void cubescript::alias::push ( const std::string &   ) 

Push value onto alias stack.

The alias object stores a stack of values, when the apply or value method is called, the last pushed value is always the value used by these two methods.

Note:
push and pop are accessible runtime functions.

bool cubescript::alias::pop (  ) 

Remove latest value from alias stack.

void_t cubescript::alias::result ( std::string   ) 

Set the result to be returned from the apply method.

As an accessible core runtime function, it allows the scripter to explicitly set a return value from an alias function call, by default, the return value of the alias is the return value of the last expression in alias's code block.

std::string cubescript::alias::apply ( std::list< std::string > &  args,
domain *   
) [virtual]

Call the alias with the given argument list.

Evaluates the stored code block, with the given arguments. The passed arguments are accessible, by the alias code block, under symbol names using the convention $arg[1 to n], for example $arg1 and $arg2.

Implements cubescript::symbol.

Get the alias's stored value.

Implements cubescript::symbol.
